p: One of the traditional healers confirmed the warning that there is a need to carefully consider the use of Senna plant seeds in traditional remedies as the seeds of Senna occidentalis could be lethal [ 137]. The oral administration to rats of Elephantorrhiza elephantina extract was reported to lead to a decrease in their respiratory rate [ 123]. However, a report [ 52] confirmed that the use of Elaeodendron transvaalense showed few side effects. A report indicated that the extracts of D. sanguinea induced cardiac glycoside poisoning in sheep [ 138]. Foetidin, isolated from member of the Cucurbitaceae, has been reported to be toxic to certain cell lines [ 52]. Crude methanol and dichloromethane extracts of S. didymobotrya roots were reported to be toxic after a period of 14 days, killing 80% of mice at a dose of 5000 mg/kg body weight with an LD 50 of 1927 mg/kg [ 103].
